problem:
#because eia.E12 is not defined in my system. E12=[10, 12, 15, 18, 22, 27, 33, 39, 47, 56, 68, 82] mult = float(random.choice([100, 1000])) R1 = float(random.choice(E12))*mult R2 = float(random.choice(E12))*mult V1 = float(random.choice([5, 10, 15])) V2 = -float(random.choice([3.3, 7.2, 9]))
e = (V1*R2-V2*R1)/(R1+R2)
This is just a quick review of the node equation idea.
In the following circuit there is one unknown node potential, labeled \(e\). The device parameters are: \(R_1=$R1\Omega\), \(R_2=$R2\Omega\), \(V_1=$V1\)V, \(V_2=$V2\)V.
What is the unknown potential \(e\) (in Volts)?
